name: outproduce
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to produce more of something than someone or something else: The company outproduced its competitors by 33 percent. Enthusiastic employees outproduce and outperform employees who are not motivated.
More examplesFewer examplesThe study shows how mixed prairie species outproduce monocultures for biofuels and other benefits. Several common garden vegetables have a reputation for outproducing the needs of the grower.Wheat out-produces rye on good soils, and has a higher market value for bread, pastry and pasta.
